alert.note: Alert for Milwaukee; Racine; Walworth; Waukesha (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 19 at 12:58PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Milwaukee, northeastern Walworth, northwestern Racine and southern Waukesha Counties through 145 PM CDT... At 1258 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Potter Lake, or near Mukwonago, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Milwaukee, Waukesha, West Allis, Wauwatosa, New Berlin, Brookfield, Greenfield, Oak Creek, Muskego, Greendale, Hales Corners, Mukwonago, East Troy, West Milwaukee, Franklin, Wind Lake, Vernon, North Prairie, Big Bend, and Waterford North. This includes the following highways... Interstate 94 between mile markers 303 and 307. Interstate 43 between mile markers 34 and 61. Interstate 41 near mile marker 40. Interstate 41/894 between mile markers 0 and 4. Interstate 41/43/894 between mile markers 5 and 9. Interstate 41/94 between mile markers 319 and 326. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
